message: Launch CLI git cloning implementation cannot clone repositories using bare commit SHAs as refs. The run_config schema requires 40-character hex SHAs (pattern: ^[a-f0-9]{40}$), but git clone -b <SHA> fails with 'Remote branch <SHA> not found in upstream origin'. Git requires branch or tag names for the -b flag, not commit SHAs. The correct implementation would be: (1) clone default branch or use --bare, (2) fetch the specific SHA, (3) checkout that SHA. This blocks TC-520 E2E pilot execution with properly pinned refs.
suggested_fix: Modify git cloning logic in src/launch/orchestrator/repo_scout.py to support SHA refs: (1) Detect if ref matches SHA pattern ^[a-f0-9]{40}$, (2) If SHA: clone with default branch, then git fetch origin <SHA> && git checkout <SHA>, (3) If branch/tag: use existing clone logic. Alternative: Update schema to accept refs/heads/* or refs/tags/* format and modify clone logic accordingly.
